comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: It's him. He arrived in New York, like others in this series of photos, on the liner Rotterdam on December 23, 1915, and had some pithy comments about Wilson and his policy of non-intervention in the war: "With the exception of the Kaiser, outside of Germany, [Wilson is] the most unpopular head of government in the world." Also some prescient words about the war: "I do not think there will be peace for at least 2 years and possibly 5." select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F20714FE3B5B1773... The second date on the negative, 3/4/21, is when Harvey was made U.S. ambassador to Great Britain.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks for your great research, Ouij and artolog. We'll fill in the name and add some other information to the record the next time we update.
